p: During the daytime, sacred ibises disperse from their night-time roosts in order to forage in the surrounding areas. The density of individual sacred ibises, recorded in the Vercelli and Novara provinces of NW Italy from 2017 to 2019 (Supplementary Material 2), averaged 1.48 ± 0.29 ind./km 2 during the breeding period, and 3.85 ± 0.94 ind./km 2 during the winter season. The average group size was 2.08 ± 0.11 ind. during the breeding period, and 8.95 ± 1.27 ind. during the winter seasons (Fig. 2).
